snippet: President Obama’s moves to swap Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl for five Taliban members and issue restrictions on carbon emissions make it more unlikely that major proposals like an immigration overhaul can advance this year, some lawmakers warned.
abstract: Congressional Memo; Republicans say actions by Obama administration in the case of Sgt Bowe Bergdahl and in using executive authority to try to force reductions in power plant pollution make it more unlikely that major proposals like an immigration overhaul can advance in 2014.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s moves to swap Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl for five Taliban members and issue restrictions on carbon emissions make it more unlikely that major proposals like an immigration overhaul can advance this year, some lawmakers warned.

headline.main: As Obama Acts on Pollution and Bergdahl, G.O.P. Talks of an Erosion of Trust
headline.print_headline: As Obama Acts on Pollution and Captive, G.O.P. Talks of Eroding Trust
